title: As a BOC Admin User, I want to create a Partner League Team that will appear in the portal
custom_steps:
Leagues and DIvisions: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams

AC:
 - BOC Users with the correct permissions will be able to create a new team for the Partner Leagues
 - When they choose BOC as the Org, the 4 Partner League names will become available in the League Dropdown:
  -- American Association
  -- Atlantic League
  -- Frontier League
  -- Pioneer League
 - When one off the above leagues are selected, a Division drop down will appear
  -- The drop down values will be conditional based on the League selected (league/division mapping provided in the wiki)
 - When the club is created, it will visible in both the Partner League Portal and in ebis
  --

Actual: History widget is sorted with oldest transactions on top.

title: 500 Error attempting to Pre-Approve an International MNC
custom_steps:
Performed the following steps:

* Created new player in Partner Portal with non-domestic birth country (Venezuela) and added to Roster (Lake Erie Crushers)
* As test_boc_approver, on ebis Partner League page, submitted New Request for player, then accepted and approved it through Partner Portal. 
* From ebis Partner League Requests widget, clicked Create Contract > Minor League Contract
* Entered required information and updated status through Terms Accepted, clicking â€˜Ignore and Continueâ€™ for any warnings.
* After clicking â€˜Pre-approveâ€™ and clicking â€˜Ignore and Continueâ€™ again, received a 500 error
* Went back to player bio to add a Home Address and Language, which were two pieces of info requested in the warning, but continued to receive the 500 error. 

[https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/#/minor-contract?mncId=31017026&playerId=999736|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/#/minor-contract?mncId=31017026&playerId=999736]

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the Partner League Portal to consume PL roster change information through an API
custom_steps:
AC:

* Each night, the partner league portal will consume roster change information via API from the partner leagues
** Only Pioneer and Frontier League at this time
* If a player is removed from a roster, the corresponding tx / history item will be created
* If a player is added to a roster, the corresponding tx / history item will be created
* If a player is removed from a roster and added to a new roster, the corresponding tx / history items will be created
* Playerâ€™s current club will be updated
* All updates and history entries will also be reflected in the appropriate places in ebis
** Namely PL Request widget and Player Profiles
* If there are any errors, they will each be reported as an item in a list named â€œerrorsâ€�

The end point URL is:

/ebis2-partner-services-dev.ebis-gcp-npd.mlbinfra.com/ebis2-partner-services/api/league/{leagueid}/rosters

(Dev:[{color:#ffffff}https://ebis2-partner-services-dev.ebis-gcp-npd.mlbinfra.com/ebis2-partner-services/api/league/64/rosters{color}|https://ebis2-partner-services-dev.ebis-gcp-npd.mlbinfra.com/ebis2-partner-services/api/league/64/rosters]

You will need a valid partner bearer token to make request - best way to find one of those is to log into the partner portal and pull the token out of one of the requests via dev tools

Making a GET request to the endpoint will return the current rosters for the requested leagueId

Making a POST request to the endpoint will apply any changes.  The post body should be in the same format as the results returned by the GET.  (Uploading the exact same object as the GET returns will not generate any changes.  Moving a player to one roster to another will generate the appropriate updates, etc)  When uploading, not all player fields are required, you need only add a player object to a clubs players list with personId populated (example below).

The League IDs are:
2	American Association
20	Pioneer League
63	Atlantic League
64	Frontier League

POST body example:
{

Â Â Â  "leagueId": 64,

Â Â Â  "leagueName": "Frontier League",

Â Â Â  "clubs": [

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  {

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  "clubInfoId": 2356,

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  "clubName": "Evansville Otters",

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  "divisionId": 6,

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  "divisionName": null,

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  "players": [

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  {

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  "personId": 791345

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  },

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Â â€¦. <more players>

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  ]

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  },

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  â€¦ <more clubs>

Â Â Â Â  ]

}

title: As a Partner Portal API user I want to see Birth Country and Visa Required field in the League Roster API
custom_steps:
Add Birth Country and Visa Required fields to each player returned on the GET call to the roster endpoint (/ebis2-partner-services-dev.ebis-gcp-npd.mlbinfra.com/ebis2-partner-services/api/league/{leagueid}/rosters)

to return Birth Country and Visa Required fields for each player.

title: As a Partner Portal API user I want an endpoint which returns matches for a player
custom_steps:
We will expose the existing matching logic to API users via a new POST endpoint:

ebis2-partner-services/api/player/matches

The endpoint will only return matches 85% or higher (this may change as we go so it will be configurable via database)

The endpoint will take in last_name, first_name, and date of birth and match using those fields, each worth 30%

Example POST body:

{code:json}{
    "firstName": "alex",
    "lastName" :"baeza",
    "dateOfBirthAsString": "1998-04-03"
}{code}

and will return a simplified version of the matching list, example:

{code:json}{
    "matches": [
        {
            "partnerClubInfoId": 2363,
            "partnerClubName": "Boise Hawks",
            "partnerLeagueId": 20,
            "partnerLeague": "Pioneer League",
            "mlbClubName": null,
            "mlbOrgCode": null,
            "mlbOrgName": null,
            "personId": 5009366,
            "position": "1B",
            "battingSide": "Left",
            "throwingSide": "Left",
            "firstName": "Alejandro",
            "lastName": "Baeza",
            "birthCountry": "United States",
            "middleName": "Jose",
            "rosterFirstName": "Alex",
            "extendedLastName": null,
            "suffix": null,
            "height": 77,
            "weight": 235,
            "uniformNumber": "",
            "currentVisaFlag": false,
            "visaFlag": false,
            "birthCity": "Van Nuys",
            "birthSector": null,
            "birthDistrict": null,
            "dateOfBirthAsString": "1998-04-03"
        }
    ]
}{code}

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to reset my password
custom_steps:
AC:
 - This will follow the out-of-the-box reset password flow from OKTA
 - Clicking the "Sign In With OKTA" link will take you to the OKTA sign in page
 - Clicking "Need help signing in?" will reveal the "Forgot password?" link
 - User will be able to reset password by continuing through the flow

custom_steps:
AC:
 - When logged into the Partner League Portal, the user's username will be displayed at the top right of the screen
 - Clicking the username will reveal a "logout" link
 - Clicking Sign Out will sign the user out of the Partner League Portal (but not out of OKTA entirely)

title: As Partner League Portal Admin, I want the leagues and teams managed through the DB
custom_steps:
[https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams|smart-link] 

AC:

* There will be no front-end tool to manage Partner Leagues or the individual Teams
* This will all be managed through tables in the database

title: PERMISSIONS: Partner League Roles
custom_steps:
Three Roles Operate within the Portal itself:
  -- Partner League President
  -- Partner League Club Admin
  -- Partner League Club User

Four Roless Operate with EBIS:
  -- PLP BOC Admin
  -- PLP BOC Viewer
  -- PLP Club Admin
  -- PLP Club Viewer

NOTE: EBIS may be given permissions allowing them to log into the Partner League Portal (WLP works this way)

title: As a BOC user I want to make an unassigned partner portal user a league president
custom_steps:
Unassigned partner portal users can be added to a 'league president role' which will also move them into the league presidents drop down.

The options will work just like the clubs do, there will be a list of the four leagues and a BOC option (which gives the user all leagues).



AC:

* When the user chooses to edit a user's permissions in the unassigned list, there will be a dropdown to add to a league president group that includes all partner leagues + BOC.
* The user will be added to the league president group when a value is selected from the dropdown and the "Save" button is clicked. The saved user will be removed from the unassigned list and added to the League Presidents list.
* If a user that is in a league president group is edited, there will be a button that can be clicked to remove that user from the group, and they will be added to the unassigned list.

title: Update Partner League Teams and Divisions
custom_steps:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams

Some of the partner leagues re-aligned their divisions and changed some teams.  I've included the updates on the provided wiki.  These changes should be reflected in the PL Portal.

title: Partner League | move to use EBIS Okta Authorization Server
custom_steps:
As a user of both the EBIS Link and Partner applications,

I want to be able to access Partnerâ€™s API using tokens granted via EBIS Linkâ€™s authentication API

So that I can programmatically access the API



Note that users will still need the Partner-portal-user group in okta to access endpoints in the Partner API, however, this change will allow users who have both the EBIS-USER and Partner-portal-user groups to use the same access token for both applications.

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to view the Transaction History tab
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bea4784a0a8a6cd24c5e|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bea4784a0a8a6cd24c5e]

AC:

* There will be History tab in the top nav, as depicted
* Clicking the tab will load the Transaction History dashboard
* The layout will match the provided wire and data discovery
* The History tab will be the landing page for all users when logging into the portal
* The left nav will feature the 4 League logos, which will act as filters of sorts
** Whichever League logo is selected will determine which data is displayed on the page
** This functionality will carry over throughout the portal
* The header filters will allow the user to control which data is displayed in the table
* Unchecking the â€˜rangeâ€™ checkbox will remove one of the date pickers and allow the user to search for a specific date
* Request Activity will follow the visibility restrictions laid out in the data discovery

* [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafeed29916c5542e2d|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafeed29916c5542e2d]
* [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafc3bd75117abd288a|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfafc3bd75117abd288a]
* [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfae146ab75a47879965|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfae146ab75a47879965]

Leagues/Divisions/Teams: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2165506053/Partner+Leagues+and+Teams]

AC:

* On the Roster tab, there will be a roster table as depicted
** The table will match the layout in the wire
* In the top portion of the page, each team will have a hyperlink listing the number of players currently on the roster
* Clicking the hyperlink will load that team's roster in the roster table
* There will be a team dropdown above the roster table that will allow the user to select which roster is displayed
* All users may see all rosters
* User type/affiliation will determine which roster is displayed by default:
** a Club user will see their club's roster displayed by default
** a League president will see their league displayed by default and the 1st sequential team will be selected
* Note - See attached video for roster behavior at the smallest breakpoint

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to add a player to my roster
custom_steps:
Wire:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfb07ea37611091ba842
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112d6a6c892069ca752bd8c

AC:
 - When viewing the Roster page, there will be a New Player button
 - There will be a New Player button in the top Nav
 - Clicking either will bring the user to the New Player page depicted in the wire
 - When the required fields are filled in, the Create New Player button will be come active
 - Team users may add new players for their own team
  -- Team users will not be able to change the team dropdown from their team
 - Presidents may add new players for any team in their league
  -- League presidents will only be able to choose teams in their league from the dopdown
 - Clicking Create New Player will load the new player profile page
  -- The new player profile will follow the layout from the wire
 - When all required fields are complete, the Save button will become active
 - Clicking Save will create the player profile and add the player to the roster
 - A new entry will be added to the TX History

NOTE: This story does not cover any matching

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want the system to check if a new player exists on any other Partner League roster
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112d6a6c892069ca752bd8c
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bfea522ffe9bd1baaf0a

AC:
 - When the user enters the 4 required matching fields and clicks the "Create New Player" button, the system will perform a match check to see if the player exists on Partner League Club Roster (in any league)
 - If a player is found, the system will return the provided matching modal
 - There will be a 'Continue Creating New Player' and a 'Cancel' button
 - Clicking 'Cancel' will dismiss the modal and return the user to the New Player screen
 - Clicking "Continue...' will bring the user to a new player profile and allow them to continue creating the new player

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want the system to check if a new players exists in EBIS or is a non-active portal player
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112d6a6c892069ca752bd8c
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bfea522ffe9bd1baaf0a

AC:
 - When the user enters the 4 required matching fields and clicks the "Create New Player" button, the system will perform a match check to see if the player exists in EBIS or if they are an inactive Partner League player
 - If a player is found, the system will return the provided matching modal
 - There will be a 'Continue Creating New Player' and a 'Cancel' button
 - Clicking 'Cancel' will dismiss the modal and return the user to the New Player screen
 - Clicking "Continue...' will bring the user to a new player profile and allow them to continue creating the new player
 - There will also be an 'Add to Roster" button, as depicted
 - Clicking the 'Add to Roster' button will place the matching player profile on the appropriate team's roster, dismiss the modal, and bring the user to the team's roster page
 - The system will also display  a green success notification, as depicted

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to remove a player from a roster
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/60f9cfb07ea37611091ba842
 - https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/6112bfeaa33e589cd2740617

AC:
 - When viewing a team's roster, users with the appropriate permissions will see a Trash Can icon next to each player's name, as depicted in the provided wire
 - Clicking the icon will launch the provided "Remove player from roster' modal
 - There will be a 'Remove Player' and 'Cancel' button on the modal
 - Clicking the 'Cancel' button will dismiss the modal and return the user to the team's roster
 - Clicking 'Remove Player' will remove the selected player from the roster, dismiss the modal, and return the user to the team's roster page
 - A green 'Removed' success message will also be displayed

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to View/Edit a Player's Profile
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - Editable: https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61269d2d6f9e93a12a4b0d34

AC:
 - Any time a player's name is displayed in the portal, it will be a hyperlink to the portal
  -- Roster widgets, Request widgets, etc
 - Clicking the player's name will open the player's profile
 - Users with permission to edit the player's profile will see a the profile open as an editable form
 - There will be a 'Close' button and a 'Save' button
 - The Save button will be inactive until a user makes any edits to the form
 - If the save button is clicked, the form will be updated, committing any changes to the DB, a success notification will be displayed, and the Save button will become inactive again
 - If there are unsaved changes on the form, and Close is clicked, the user will be asked to confirm their actions"
  - Clicking Cancel will bring the user back to the unsaved form
 - Clicking Continue will dismiss the changes and return the user to their entry point
 - If there no unsaved changes on the form and Close is clicked, the user will be returned to their entry point without any prompting or modals

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to View a Player's Profile
custom_steps:

AC:
 - Clicking a player's name will open the player's profile
 - Users without the permission to edit the player's profile will see a the profile open as an ineditable form
  -- The user will not be able to make edits
 - There will be a 'Close' button
 - Clicking Close will return the user to their entry point without any prompting or modals

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to attach a file to Player's Profile

AC:
 - This covers attaching a file to profile

title: As a partner portal user, I should only see contact information entered into the partner portal
custom_steps:
Partner portal users should not see contact information associated with existing MLB players.  Only information entered into the portal itself should be visible.  

Additionally, contact info for a player who is on a roster should only be visible to users for that club, league presidents for that league, or the overall league president super user (BOCs user).  Club users should not see contact info for other clubs players and league presidents cannot see contact info for other league's players.  This info should also be hidden in the response from the REST service: when using browser dev tools, it should not be visible in the response.

Contact info consists of: Phone Numbers, Email Address, Addresses, National IDs and file attachments.

Those sections should not be displayed on the screen when viewing a player who the user doesn't have permission to see.

Developer note:  Create new tables to mimic the existing contact tables for a person object (person_phone_number_assoc, person_email_address, person_address_assoc. person_profile_national_id, person_file_attachment_assoc)

AC:
* Contact info for partner portal players is specific to the partner portal and is not tied to the existing player info in ebis
* League presidents can only see contact info for players on rosters of their league
* Club users can only see contact info for players on their club's roster

title: As a partner portal user, I want to open a profile in a new tab from the match modal
custom_steps:
When creating a new player if there are matches, there should be an option to open the profile in a new tab/window.  
Its currently not possible to right click on the link and do that.  If it can be fixed so that option is available then that should be sufficient.  If not we'll need to add another icon to click on for this purpose.

Wireframe: [https://zpl.io/ag1708Z|https://zpl.io/ag1708Z|smart-link] 

AC

* User can open profiles from the match modal in a new tab/window

title: As an ebis user, when viewing a partner portal player I want to see the partner portal contact info
custom_steps:
This story is dependent on https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1106

When viewing a partner portal person type in ebis (person_type_id = 8) the contact info displayed should be the partner portal info and not the actual person contact info tables.

Contact info consists of: Phone Numbers, Email Address, Addresses, National IDs and file attachments.

AC:
* When viewing a person_type_id of 8, contact info comes from the partner portal
* When viewing a person who is on a partner portal roster, but not of person_type_id 8 then continue to display the ebis contact information.

title: As an ebis user, I want to see partner portal roster updates in their ebis player history
custom_steps:
The profile player history for professional (or employees) in ebis should show when the player is added or removed from a partner league roster.  

The short value will be "Partner Add" and "Partner Remove" and the description will read:
Player added to the <team> Roster of the <league>

where <team> and <league> are the appropriate leagues.

AC:
* When an existing ebis player is added to a partner roster there will be an appropriate line item in their player history
* When an existing ebis player is removed from a partner roster there will be an appropriate line item in their player history

title: As a BOC user, on the partner portal users page in EBIS, I want to see which league a user belongs
custom_steps:
When viewing a user in the partner portal users utility in EBIS, I want to see which league they belong to

AC:

* When viewing a single user display the league name that the user is president of for any league presidents on the partner portal users page
* When viewing a listing of users include their league in the results

title: As an ebis user, I want signing a former MLB player who is on a partner roster to a new contract to update their profile
custom_steps:
After a request is approved and accepted for a professional player currently on a partner portal roster signing them to a major or minor contract should remove them from the partner portal (adding a remove from roster item) and they should appear on their new club.

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (SGNMN transaction) and for major contracts its upon approval of the Sign To Major League Roster transaction (created behind the scenes by MJC upon terms confirmed, but also can be created manually)

AC:

* Pro player on a partner portal roster is removed from partner roster and appears on mlb club roster after moving a new MNC to terms accepted.
* Pro player on a partner portal roster is removed from partner roster and appears on mlb club roster after approving the sign to major league roster transaction
* A Remove/MLB Signing activity is added to the partner portal activity list and to the playerâ€™s history.

title: As a Partner League Portal User, I want to view the Requests Dashboard in the Partner League Portal
custom_steps:
Wire:  https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef
Data Discovery: https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/2254798893/Partner+League+Portal+-+Requests+Widget

AC:
 - In the top Nav of the Partner League Portal, there will be a Requests link, as depicted
 - Clicking Requests will load the Requests dashboard
 - The dashboard will match the provided wire and data discovery
 - The icons in the left nav will continue serving as a filter for the data displayed on the page
  -- Clicking American Assoc will display American Assoc data, etc.
 - Club users will only see request data pertaining to their club
 - League Presidents will see all request data for their League, but no data for other Leagues
 - A BOC User would see all request data across leagues

title: As a Club User, I want to create a new Partner League Request
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=create_a_request&g=1

AC:
 - Admin users will see a "New Request" button in the footer of the Partner League Requests widget
 - Clicking the button will launch the New Request modal
 - There will be a Cancel button on the modal
  -- Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
 - There will be a Player search box
  -- The Player box will be an autocompleter that is populated with *all* players currently appearing on Partner League Team Rosters
 - Selecting a player from the autocompleter will activate the Submit Request button
 - Clicking "Submit Request" will:
  -- Submit the request
  -- Dismiss the modal
  -- Display a blue "Submitted" success popup
 - The new request will be displayed in both the Partner League Requests widget in ebis and the Requests dashboard in the Partner League Portal

title: As an EBIS User, I want to Cancel a Partner League Request from EBIS
custom_steps:
Wires:
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=partner_league_requests&g=1
 - https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#p=cancel_request&g=1

AC:
 - Users with appropriate Admin permissions, will see a Cancel Request button in the Partner League Requests widget, as depicted
 - The Cancel Request button will only appear on requests that are Submitted, or Accepted, and have not yet expired
 - Clicking the button will launch a confirmation modal:
  -- Title: Are You Sure?
  -- Body: Are you sure you want to cancel the request for:
               [Player Name] - [POS] - [Team Name]
 - The modal will have a Cancel Request button and a Back button
 - Clicking the Back button will dismiss the modal and no further action will be taken
 - Clicking Cancel Request will update the request's status to Cancelled and remove the expiration date

title: As a Partner League President, I want to be notified when a new request is submitted
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a Partner League request reaches submitted state, the system will generate a notification email
* The email will be sent the any users with the League President role for the league the player is playing in
* The email will also be sent to the BOC League President Role
* The email will read as follows:
** Subject: New Partner League Request
** Body:  The \[MJ Submitting Org] submitted a new Partner League Request on \[submission date of request] for \[Player Roster First, Last] of the \[Partner League Club Name].

Please log into the Partner League Portal to Accept.

title: As a Partner League Club Admin, I want to be notified when a new request is Accepted
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a Partner League request reaches Accepted state, the system will generate a notification email
* The email will be sent the any users with the Partner League Club Admin role for the team the player is playing on
* The email will read as follows:
** Subject: New Partner League Request
** Body:  A new Partner League request from the \[MJ Submitting Org] for \[Player Roster First, Last] has been accepted.  This request will expire in 48 hours.
Please log into the Partner League Portal to approve.

title: As a Partner League Club Admin, I want to Approve a new request
custom_steps:
Wires:

Utility: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/61157b0b4e63099b430a28ef|smart-link] 

Modal: [https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/611d3dcf260c7b1848168bac|https://app.zeplin.io/project/60f9cefab9f8fc11cbc32d10/screen/611d3dcf260c7b1848168bac|smart-link] 

AC:

* When a user with the Partner League Club Admin role is viewing the Requests utility *for their own club*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
* When a user with the Partner League President role is viewing the Requests utility *for their own league*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
* When a user with the PLP BOC Admin role is viewing the Requests utility *for any league*, they will see an Approve button on any request in Accepted state
* Clicking the Approve button will launch the provided modal, prompting the user to confirm their action
** There will be an Approve button and a Cancel button
** Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
** Clicking Approve will update the requests status to Approved, dismiss the modal, and display an Approved success message
* When the request reaches Approved state, appropriate Email notifications (covered in separate story) will be sent out
* When the request becomes Approved, the expiration date will be removed from the Request widget in both EBIS and the Portal.

title: As an ebis user, I want to be prevented from submitting a contract for a player who is on a partner portal roster
custom_steps:
Upon attempting to submit either a major, a minor OR a sign to major league roster transaction we will check to see if the player in question is on a partner league roster.  If they are, we will additionally check to see if there is an existing. approved partner league request for that player and for the corresponding org.

If there is no request, the user will receive a the following message:
This player is currently on a Partner League roster and requires an approved request before signing.

Please contact the BOC.

This will be a hard error for clubs and a warning for BOC

AC:

* An approved partner league request for the specified org is required for submission of a minor contract for a player who is on a partner league roster
* An approved partner league request for the specified org is required for submission of a major contract for a player who is on a partner league roster
* An approved partner league request for the specified org is required for submission of a sign to major league roster for a player who is on a partner league roster
* If none is found, a message is displayed:
*BODY:* This player is currently on a Partner League roster and requires an approved request before signing.

Please contact the BOC.

* Message will be a hard error for club users
* Message will be overridable for BOC users

title: As a User, when creating a new minor contract for a Partner Portal type player I want the system to correctly determine which type of contract it should be
custom_steps:
Upon creation of a minor contract for a player who is ONLY entered into the partner portal and was not a prior existing ebis player (person type id is equal to eight) I want the system to decide which type of minor contract should be created: Domestic or International.  In order to decide, the playerâ€™s birth country will be used.  If the player was born in the US, Canada, Puerto Rico or Guam then the contract should be considered a domestic contract.  For any other country, the contract will be considered international.  All contracts created for these players will be considered first year contracts - there will be no non first year.

AC:

* When a partner league player has an approved request in the PL Request widget, Club users will have the ability to create a new contract.
* If the user chooses to create a new MNC, the playerâ€™s birth country will determine which type of contract is created:
** US, Canada, Puerto Rico or Guam: 1st Year Domestic
** Any other birth country: 1st Year International

title: As a user, I want a minor contract created for a Partner Portal type player to use contact info from the partner portal contact info tables
custom_steps:
New minor contracts created for a partner portal player will pull contact info from the partner portal contact info tables.  The info will appear on the contract in the Summary section (Permanent Street Address and City, State, Zip fields) as well as on the printed contract in the addendum A section.  

Additionally all appropriate bio information should be displayed on the printed contract (though this should not require any changes as we're storing them in the same place as the pro player).

AC
* For a Partner Portal Type player - Contact info will be pulled from the partner portal into a newly created minor contract 
* Info will also displayed correctly when printing the contract.

title: As a User, I want a Partner Portal Type player to become a professional player upon signing them to a contract
custom_steps:
Upon signing a partner portal type player (type = 8 ) to a contract, the player should become a professional player.  If the player was on a partner portal roster, they should be removed from that roster and there should be a history item added for them (activity is Removed/MLB Signing).  Any contact info entered into the parter portal profile will be carried forward onto their new professional profile.

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (SGNMN transaction) and for major contracts its upon approval of the Sign To Major League Roster transaction (created behind the scenes by MJC upon terms confirmed, but also can be created manually)

AC:
* When a partner portal type player (type eight) is signed to a contract they will become a professional player (person type is now 2)
* If the player was on a partner portal roster, they will be removed from that roster
* If the player was on a partner portal roster, there will be a new history item added for the player with activity of Removed/MLB Signing
* Contact info entered on the partner portal will be carried forward onto the new professional profile

title: As a user, I want a Partner Portal Type (8) player with a domestic birth country who signs a minor league contract to be considred a passed over player
custom_steps:
Upon signing a Partner Portal Type (type eight) player with a domestic birth country (US, Canada, PR, Guam, VI) to a domestic minor league contract the player will appear as passed over in the most recent draft.

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (in the SGNMN transaction) 

AC:
* When SGNMN or SGNXT transaction for type 8 player with a domestic birth country is approved (mnc moved to terms accepted) the player will be listed as a passed over player
* Professional profile for the player will have the draft page and will have a line item for 'passed over' in the most recent draft

title: As a user, I want a Partner Portal Type (8) player with a non domestic birth country who signs a minor league contract to be considred an international player
custom_steps:
Upon signing a Partner Portal Type (type eight) player with a non domestic birth country (anything but US, Canada, PR, Guam, VI) to an international minor league contract the player will appear as an international player
(international_player_flag will be true)

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (in the SGNMN transaction) 

AC:
* When SGNMN or SGNXT transaction for type 8 player with a non domestic birth country is approved (mnc moved to terms accepted) the player will be listed as an international player
* Professional profile for the player will have the international tab

title: As a user, I want an amateur (domestic or international) player to be removed from the partner roster upon signing a new contract
custom_steps:
Upon signing an amateur player (type 5 or 6) who is on a partner roster to a contract, the player should be removed from that roster and there should be a history item added for them (activity is Removed/MLB Signing).  

For minor contracts this happens at terms accepted state (SGNMN transaction) and for major contracts its upon approval of the Sign To Major League Roster transaction (created behind the scenes by MJC upon terms confirmed, but also can be created manually)

AC:
* When an amateur (type 5 or 6) player is signed to a contract they will be removed from any partner portal roster
* There will be a new history item added for the player with activity of Removed/MLB Signing

title: Creating a new MNC for a partner portal player should be linked to the partner portal request regardless of where it was initiated
custom_steps:
Currently the system is only linking partner requests to created contracts when the â€˜create contractâ€™ button on the partner league request is clicked. 

Instead, for minor contracts, we should link the contract to the request regardless of how it was created.

title: As a BOC user, I want to see and edit the email addresses for partner portal users
custom_steps:
Add the users email address to the partner portal users screen in ebis when viewing a user.

The field should be editable when the screen is in edit mode and saved upon clicking save.

AC:
* User's email address is visible on the Partner Portal Users page
* User's email address is editable on the Partner Portal Users page
* User's email is saved upon clicking save on the Partner Portal Users page

[Atlanticpresident@mlb.com|mailto:Atlanticpresident@mlb.com] (atlantic lg president) can view other leagues Request data. View League_Pres screenshot. The clubs circled all belong to the American Association league and this data shouldnt display

title: Partner League Portal - Data displays incorrectly for past dates

# uncheck Range checkbox
# select 02/06/2022

actual: data from 02/07 or 02/08 display

actual: Year dropdown = 2021 (view 2021 screenshot)

title: Partner League Portal - Updates to Create Request workflow for BOC
custom_steps:
BOC PLP Admins can create Request for any ORG but regardless of what ORG is selected from the ORG dropdown, it sets the ORG to ARI

Steps to Repro: 

# Log in as BOC PLP Admin (test_boc_approver
# Navigate to partner portal request widget (from roster tab on left nav)
# In Request widget, default ORG DD value is ALL ORGs. Change to any ORG except ARI. (in this case, lets use WSH) 
# Create and Submit request for WSH (view Boc_Req_Wsh screenshot)

Expected - Request displays under WSH (or whichever ORG was selected)

Actual - ORG field value is set to ARI for all Requests created by BOC so Requests display under ARI 

view Boc_Req_Ari

title: Partner League Portal - "New Request" Modal updates for BOC PLP admin user
custom_steps:
updates only for BOC PLP Admin user

Previously, when BOC PLP admin clicked the New Request button, a modal would display without the option of selecting an ORG. 

view [https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_a_request|https://r6hmqn.axshare.com/#g=1&p=create_a_request] for updates to modal (scroll to right, view Request - BOC)



AC: 

* â€œRequest On Behalf Ofâ€� is required field in order to submit request
* â€œRequest On Behalf Ofâ€� dropdown values = Ari to Wsh 

* If â€œAll ORGSâ€� is selected on PLP Request widget, â€œRequest On Behalf Ofâ€� dropdown will display blank for BOC to select ORG.
* IF user filters ORG dropdown on Request widget, then â€œRequest On Behalf Ofâ€� dropdown value in modal will default to the ORG that was filtered on the widget.

# create player
# enter all required info - 
# view Birth Date field in the following player profile, matching modals, roster widget (any place Birth Date field is visible)

expected: Birth Date throughout PLP matches the Birth Date entered during Create New process

actual: birth date value = birth date entered minus one day

title: Partner League Portal - Birth Date field inactive on tablet
custom_steps:
Viewing Partner League Portal on the IPAD - 

after clicking New Player button, user must enter all the required fields in order to proceed with creating a new player. All fields are correctly highlighted red (required) except Birth Date field. Clicking on the date picker opens the calendar but then the page becomes blank without anything displaying.

# log into plp as any user type
# click create new player button
# view all required fields 

expected: all required fields are highlighted red

actual: Birth Date field is not highlighted

5. click on Birth Date field (this enables the date picker)

6. click on any date

expected: Date value to display in filed

actual: page fully blanks out. nothing displays

title: Partner League Portal - Edits made to a New Player not saving
custom_steps:

Create a new player and click Save.
Make an additional edit and click Save.
Blank screen displays and url is 'player/new'. 
Click browser refresh and a blank 'new player' screen is displayed.
From there, click History and open original player. Original edits not displayed.
Add edits again, click Save and edit takes.

title: Partner portal users screen for league presidents incorrectly displays the league president's group
custom_steps:
The logic to display the league a partner league president is from is encapsulated within the role group repeat and is displaying the unmapped group associated with the index on the repeat.  Since there is only ever one role, that means it displays the first unmapped group.   In most cases, this is the league group, however it doesnt have to be.  (see [bearle1995@gmail.com|mailto:bearle1995@gmail.com] for an example - it shows Partner API User rather than frontier president).

The logic should be corrected to show only the partner league president role in that spot (and it shouldnt be repeated if there are ever more roles added).
